arts.ttl: Sunderland v Arsenal: Premier League – live
arts.sum: ⚽ Premier League updates from the 5.30pm GMT kick-off ⚽ Live scores | Edwards in talks with Wolves | Mail Scott Sunderland are in If It Ain’t Broke mode. They name the same XI that started the 2-1 win at Chelsea and the 1-1 draw with Everton. This will be the first time Granit Xhaka has faced Arsenal since leaving the Gunners two years ago. Arsenal make three changes after their 3-0 win at Slavia Prague. Eberechi Eze, Martín Zubimendi and Riccardo Calafiori step up; Ethan Nwaneri, Christian Nørgaard and Piero Hincapié sit down. Viktor Gyökeres remains on the injury list with a hamstring problem. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Arsenal make three changes as Xhaka starts for Sunderland LIVE on Sky!
arts.sum: However, when asked to confirm that all of Kai Havertz, Martin Odegaard, Viktor Gyokeres, Noni Madueke, Gabriel Martinelli and Gabriel Jesus remain unavailable, he said: "I cannot confirm all of that but you are not far!" Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta reported no new fitness concerns for Sunday's game against Sunderland, live on Sky Sports, and stopped short of ruling all of his injured players out of contention.
